page.title: 11DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: This is a rural area situated on the edge of the Chiltern Hills on the borders of Hertfordshir and Bucking- hamshire, 25miles north of London. It is approx. 600ft. above sea level and the soil is clay on chalk & flints. There are several underground springs & rivers. The land is arable,pasture and woodland & has two villages,Ashley Green & Whelpley Hill both of the same Parish with a population of 1000. Ashley Green is one of the typical Chiltern villages cosisting of a long 'green' with a Church,Post Office/shop Village Hall & a school building which is now a Community Association & a Pub unfortunately it is dissected by the Berkhamsted/Chesham road.Whelpley Hill is the smaller village with a Church & Council caravan site of 100 caravans. Hourly buses serve both villages.
